abstract: <jats:p>The purpose of this study was to develop a real‐time<jats:styled-content style="fixed-case">PCR</jats:styled-content>assay to specifically identify lake whitefish<jats:italic>Coregonus clupeaformis</jats:italic>in larval fish assemblages based on a 122 bp amplicon from the mitochondrial genome. The efficiency of the reaction, as calculated from the standard curve, was 90·77% with the standard curve having an<jats:italic>r</jats:italic><jats:sup>2</jats:sup>value of 0·998. Specificity of the assay provided single melt peak in a melt‐curve analysis and amplification of only the target species. The assay successfully identified target<jats:styled-content style="fixed-case">DNA</jats:styled-content>in as low as 0·1% proportion of a<jats:styled-content style="fixed-case">DNA</jats:styled-content>mixture. This assay was designed on the portable Smart Cycler<jats:styled-content style="fixed-case">II</jats:styled-content>platform and can be used in both field and laboratory settings to successfully identify<jats:italic>C. clupeaformis</jats:italic>.</jats:p>
title: Real‐timePCRidentification of lake whitefishCoregonus clupeaformisin theLaurentianGreatLakes
